0.rationale:
I'll think through the four moves and pick a safe, apple-focused option.

Immediate safety:
- From (6,6) all 4 directions are on-board and there are no bodies to collide with, so UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT are all immediately safe now.
- Enemy (3,0) is far away, so no immediate head-on risk this turn.

Which moves move toward apples and keep options open:
- RIGHT -> (7,6): moves closer to both nearby apples at (7,7) and (7,5). From (7,6) next turn I can go UP to get (7,7) or DOWN to get (7,5). Keeps two apple options open.
- UP -> (6,7): gets me closer to (7,7) but not to (7,5); fewer immediate apple options than RIGHT.
- DOWN -> (6,5): gets me closer to (7,5) and somewhat to (5,4), but still only one immediate nearby apple option.
- LEFT -> (5,6): moves away from the nearest apples; less desirable.

Long-term plan:
- Move RIGHT now to reach (7,6). On the next turn prioritize taking either (7,7) or (7,5) depending on which is safe (and on the opponent's movement). Maintain mobility by not forcing myself into a corner; after grabbing a nearby apple, reassess and head toward the next closest apple (likely (5,4) or (2,6)).

RIGHT

Immediate safety check:
- From (7,6) all four moves are on-board and there are no bodies to collide with now. Enemy at (4,0) is far away so no immediate head-on threat.
- Eating an apple will cause me to grow to length 2, so I must avoid trying to immediately move back into the cell I just came from on the next turn.

Which apple to take:
- There are apples at (7,7) and (7,5) adjacent to me. Taking either is safe this turn.
- I choose DOWN -> (7,5). This eats an apple and positions me closer to the apple cluster toward (5,4) and (2,6)/(1,5), giving a clearer route to the next targets.
- Note: after eating, my body will be [(7,5),(7,6)], so I cannot move UP next turn (that would be moving directly into my own body). Good follow-ups after eating are LEFT to (6,5) (toward (5,4)) or RIGHT to (8,5) to keep options open.

Short plan for next turns:
- After eating at (7,5), avoid moving UP next turn. Prefer LEFT toward (5,4) to collect that apple, while staying aware of the enemy's position. Reevaluate after each turn.

DOWN

Immediate safety check:
- UP is illegal (would move directly into my body at (7,6) and kill me).
- LEFT -> (6,5), DOWN -> (7,4), RIGHT -> (8,5) are all on-board and not into any body or apple-blocked cell.
- Enemy (4,1) is far away, so no head-on risk this turn.

Which move and why:
- Goal is to get the apple at (5,4). From (7,5) that apple is Manhattan distance 3.
- LEFT to (6,5) reduces distance to that apple and keeps three follow-up options (UP, LEFT, DOWN). After LEFT my body will be [(6,5),(7,5)], so I must not move RIGHT next turn (that would be reversing).
- DOWN to (7,4) is also reasonable, but LEFT shifts me closer horizontally and gives a straightforward path: then DOWN to (6,4) and LEFT to (5,4).
- RIGHT moves away from nearby apples and is less useful.

Short plan for next turns:
- After LEFT -> (6,5), avoid RIGHT next turn. Prefer DOWN to (6,4) then LEFT to take the apple at (5,4). Reevaluate after enemy moves.

LEFT

Safety check:
- RIGHT is illegal (would move into my body at (7,5) — reversing).
- UP (6,6), LEFT (5,5), DOWN (6,4) are all on-board and not occupied by any body segment.

Why DOWN:
- The closest apple is at (5,4). Moving DOWN to (6,4) keeps a straightforward two-step path: then LEFT to (5,4) to eat it.
- DOWN keeps multiple follow-up options (LEFT to eat, or continue exploring downward/leftward space) and avoids heading away from nearby apples.
- Enemy (4,2) is far and unlikely to contest (5,4) this turn, and there’s no immediate head-on risk.

Short plan:
- This turn: DOWN -> (6,4).
- Next turn: LEFT to (5,4) to take the apple, then reassess and head toward the next closest apple while avoiding collisions.

DOWN

Analysis of moves:
- UP -> (6,5) is illegal: that's my own body segment (would be reversing).
- LEFT -> (5,4) is legal and contains an apple (immediate +1).
- DOWN -> (6,3) is legal but moves away from the nearby apple.
- RIGHT -> (7,4) is legal but also moves away from the closest apple.

Safety and outcome:
- LEFT instantaneously eats the apple at (5,4). No enemy can reach (5,4) this turn (enemy at (5,2) can only move to y=3 at best), so no head-on collision risk.
- Eating is high priority and keeps options open: after (5,4) I can continue toward apples at (1,5) and (2,6) while avoiding tight trapping.

Short plan for next turns:
- This turn: LEFT to eat (5,4).
- Next: reassess and head toward (1,5)/(2,6) while keeping space and avoiding head-on encounters.

LEFT

Analysis of possible moves from head (5,4):

- RIGHT -> (6,4): illegal — that's the segment directly behind my head (would be reversing into my own body).
- DOWN -> (5,3): currently occupied by enemy head. Moving there risks an unpredictable head-on outcome; while it can be safe if the enemy moves away (or they might move into my head and die), it's unnecessary risk when a safe apple-directed alternative exists.
- UP -> (5,5): legal and moves me closer to the cluster of apples around y=5. (Note: (6,5) is occupied by my body so RIGHT from there would be blocked.)
- LEFT -> (4,4): legal, moves toward the nearby apples (notably (3,5)) while keeping distance from the enemy at (5,3).

I prefer a conservative, apple-focused move that avoids close contact with the lone enemy head. LEFT brings me closer to the apple at (3,5) while steering away from the enemy and keeping multiple escape routes open (up, left, down from the new position), minimizing the chance of getting boxed in or forced into a risky head-on.

Short plan for next turns:
- Head toward the (3,5)/(1,5)/(2,6) cluster, taking apples while maintaining at least two exit directions from my head each turn.
- Avoid moving into the column where the enemy is centered unless I have a clear numerical/positional advantage; force the enemy to be the one taking suicidal moves if possible.

LEFT

Legal moves from head (4,4):
- RIGHT -> (5,4): illegal (directly into my body / reversal).
- DOWN -> (4,3): occupied by enemy head — risky (possible head-on or unpredictable swap).
- LEFT -> (3,4): legal, moves toward the (3,5)/(1,5)/(2,6) apple cluster.
- UP -> (4,5): legal, also moves toward that cluster while increasing distance from the enemy at (4,3).

I prefer a conservative safe move that keeps multiple exits open and moves toward nearby apples. UP to (4,5) stays away from the enemy head (reducing head-on risk), and on the next turn I can go LEFT to take the apple at (3,5) or continue toward (2,6)/(1,5). It preserves at least two safe follow-up directions (left and right/up), minimizing chances of being trapped.

Short plan: Head toward the (3,5)/(2,6)/(1,5) cluster while avoiding the column near the enemy. Take the (3,5) apple next, then continue to (2,6)/(1,5), keeping at least two escape options each turn.

UP
